meanings.definition: A unit of electromotive force equal to one billionth of a volt.
meanings.sent1: I measured the tiny amount of abvolts needed to power the small device.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the abvolts required for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The abvolts in the battery were so small, they barely made a flicker.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like abvolts, quietly powering her through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The abvolts in the wire were like whispers of energy, almost imperceptible.

meanings.definition: The measurement of electrical potential difference in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The technician checked the abvolts to ensure the circuit was functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: Abvolts are crucial in determining the efficiency of electrical systems.
meanings.sent3: The abvolts reading on the meter made the electrician chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electricity, abvolts can be the silent heroes of power.
meanings.sent5: The fluctuating abvolts painted a vivid picture of the circuit's health.
